alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 11:38PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in New Jersey...Hunterdon, Mercer, and Somerset. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Doylestown, Byram, Chalfont, Pennington, New Hope, Hopewell, Stockton, Sergeantsville, Sand Brook, Lumberville, Cloverhill, and Lawrenceville. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 62 and 72. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 3. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
